iwzzz1fB8rryKTsotRIoHw.text: Exactly the food we were looking for. Some falafel, fresh bread and delicious dips. Clean flavours and really well balanced.The restaurant looks like it hasn't been updated since the 1980s but don't let the decor detract from the authentic tastes.

photos.caption: Photo of Byblos Grill - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Byblos Grill - Singapore, Singapore

U9PdZP56TRuDek61ky9kTQ.text: Had an excellent vegetarian mezze plate here plus a side of falafel.Delicious and the perfect amount to share between two of you want to end up quite full. Friendly staff and good food.

11FWUXBXOQF-XT3n3j1ypw.text: Sitting in the restaurant right now. It is past the lunch rush and there is one more customer in the restaurant. Still we have been waiting for 45 min for two wraps. Not anything fancy or complicated, just two simple wraps and we still have not recieved our food. As I'm writing this now, the food just arrived. After tasting it I feel really cheated! First of all, i had asked for extra pickle in my wrap. What I got was a total of two tiny pieces of pickle in the whole wrap. The flavour is mediocre at best, nothing special about it at all. And for the price of $15.50+tax I feel this place is a real rip off! The reviews at Yelp and Google had given this restaurant high rating, which is why we decided to go in in the first place. I truly regret that now. Do not come here! There are way better and cheaper places with better customer service! The only reason Byblos Grill gets a one star rating is because I am not able to give it zero stars. It really is that bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Byblos Grill - Singapore, Singapore. Very poor wrap that took almost an hour(!) to prepare! Mostly filled with tasteless lettuce. Service is super bad!!!

4iDAONGLseudvEE-CaOWxg.text: The food is ho hum, which means it's at least one star better than the service. The lavash was the best thing in the menu. The baba ganoush was, quite frankly, gross but the lamb was flavorful. Nothing can make up for the absolutely atrocious service though. It really should not have to take 45 minutes to get a bill, for example. Nor should the main courses arrive 30 minutes apart.

EwFgYnaLTNGPFyQt4LVqVw.text: Amazing food and great service, ask for Imad he was such a great server and host!We ordered shawarma, moustaka, mezze plate and falafel.  All were amazing.  It is hard to pick restaurants with so many choices but this one stands out!

vDPgxEAVOwpmEzXYfJOWbA.text: We had been craving Lebanese food since our last trip to London and was glad this place opened recently around Arab Street. Food wise, everything tasted fresh and delicious and the portions were huge by SG standards. Only complaint is the service is a little slow and the waiters, though friendly, don't seem to be able to speak any English.

photos.caption: Photo of Byblos Grill - Singapore, Singapore. Lamb Mandi
Photo of Byblos Grill - Singapore, Singapore. Mezzo Platter
Photo of Byblos Grill - Singapore, Singapore

CsMM9HvcSpCu9eU_26Z4nw.text: Food was good, service was very slow even though it was not busy for lunch. Not sure why the high rating, about average I'd say.

hAyKEo9HC4P4cueR4mGbSA.text: Best food and amazing owner! So generous and took the time to tell us (tourists) where to go, eat, things to do, etc. highly recommended. Also, amazing atmosphere too!
